definition: insignificant soldier (idiom)/a nobody/nonentity
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
small/tiny/few/young
soldier/servant/to finish/to die/finally/at last/pawn in Chinese chess
variant of 猝[cu4]

sentences.english: They think themselves(to be)somebodies, but they are really nobodies.
sentences.chinese: 他們自以爲是大人物，但他們真的是無名小卒。
他只是個無名小卒，”布勞恩說。

sentences.english: As a pair, they aren't really nobodies anymore.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一對兒，他們其實不再是真正的“無名小卒”。

sentences.english: And she doesn't want to be banished or kicked out from what she sees as a society of nobodies.
sentences.chinese: 她不願意被驅逐出無名小卒的團體。

sentences.english: People faver underdogs but follow only top dogs .
sentences.chinese: 人們喜歡無名小卒，卻只追隨大人物。

sentences.english: You can always tell the somebodies from the nobodies at a cocktail party.
sentences.chinese: 在雞尾酒會上人們常常可以看出大人物和無名小卒來。

sentences.english: I have been more concerned with the obscure than with the famous.
sentences.chinese: 比之名流顯士，我更加關注無名小卒。

sentences.english: Gender Studies is definitely worth checking out and the English department has changed me from novice writer to aspiring author.
sentences.chinese: 英語專業也使我從一個無名小卒到胸有大志的作家。

sentences.english: Being "nobodies" helps them find each other.
sentences.chinese: 做一個“無名小卒”讓他們遇見了對方。

definition: words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
talented field commander (military)
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to be neither too familiar nor too distant/to keep sb at arm's length
to die in battle (idiom)
lit. a notch on the side of a boat to locate a sword dropped overboard (idiom); fig. an action made pointless by changed circumstances
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
a friend in times of tribulations (idiom); a friend in need is a friend indeed
to travel around the country
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
